questions.question: What is the highest SO2 adsorption capacity achieved at atmospheric pressure and which material achieved it?
questions.answer: 11.01 mmol g−1, achieved by SIFSIX-1-Cu.

questions.question: Which material exhibits the highest SO2/CO2 selectivity and what is the range of this selectivity?
questions.answer: SIFSIX-2-Cu-i exhibits the highest SO2/CO2 selectivity, with a range of 86–89.

questions.question: How does the SO2 adsorption capacity of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i at 0.01 bar compare to that of Zn-MOF-74?
questions.answer: SIFSIX-2-Cu-i has a higher SO2 adsorption capacity at 0.01 bar (4.16 mmol g−1) compared to Zn-MOF-74 (3.03 mmol g−1).

questions.question: What role do the Sδ+···Fδ− and Oδ−···Hδ+ interactions play in the adsorption of SO2 in SIFSIX materials?
questions.answer: The Sδ+···Fδ− electrostatic interactions and Oδ−···Hδ+ dipole–dipole interactions help in the selective recognition and dense packing of SO2 clusters by firmly grasping every atom of SO2 within the pore spaces of SIFSIX materials.

questions.question: Based on the synthesis conditions, which two SIFSIX materials were specifically highlighted for their exceptional performance in SO2 adsorption and selectivity?
questions.answer: SIFSIX-1-Cu and SIFSIX-2-Cu-i were specifically highlighted for their exceptional performance in SO2 adsorption and selectivity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the pore size in the adsorption performance of SIFSIX materials?
questions.answer: A moderate pore size is crucial in SIFSIX materials as it affords adequate strength of synergistic host–guest and guest–guest interactions for dense packing of SO2, leading to high adsorption capacity and selectivity.

questions.question: How does the SO2 adsorption capacity of SIFSIX-1-Cu at 1.01 bar compare to that of MFM-202a?
questions.answer: SIFSIX-1-Cu has a higher SO2 adsorption capacity at 1.01 bar (11.01 mmol g−1) compared to MFM-202a (10.2 mmol g−1).

questions.question: Is the SO2/CO2 selectivity of SIFSIX-1-Cu higher than 50 across all SO2 molar fractions?
questions.answer: True, SIFSIX-1-Cu shows excellent SO2/CO2 separation selectivity (54–70) over a wide range of SO2 molar fraction in gas phase (0.1–0.9).

questions.question: Does the presence of moisture significantly affect the SO2 adsorption capacity of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
questions.answer: False, moisture (1000 ppm) has slightly effect on the adsorption capacity of SO2 on SIFSIX-2-Cu-i.

questions.question: Can SIFSIX materials be fully regenerated after SO2 adsorption?
questions.answer: True, SIFSIX materials adsorbed with SO2 could be fully regenerated by He flow at 313 K.

questions.question: Is the SO2/N2 selectivity of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i higher than 1000 across all SO2 molar fractions?
questions.answer: True, SIFSIX-2-Cu-i shows high SO2/N2 selectivities (1285–3103) over a wide range of SO2 molar fraction in gas phase (0.1–0.9).

questions.question: Does the SIFSIX-3-Zn material exhibit higher SO2 adsorption capacity than SIFSIX-1-Cu at low pressures?
questions.answer: False, SIFSIX-1-Cu exhibits higher SO2 adsorption capacity than SIFSIX-3-Zn at low pressures.

questions.question: Are the SIFSIX materials stable when exposed to humidity?
questions.answer: True, SIFSIX-2-Cu-i is stable when exposed to humidity (75%).

questions.question: What is the role of the SIFSIX-2-Cu-i's interpenetrated structure in its SO2 adsorption performance?
questions.answer: The interpenetrated structure of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i enables a more compact distribution of SiF62− anions, leading to strong Sδ+···Fδ− electrostatic interactions and dense packing of SO2 clusters, which enhances its SO2 adsorption performance at low pressures.

questions.question: How does the experimental breakthrough performance of SIFSIX-2-Cu-i for SO2/N2 separation compare to that of SIFSIX-1-Cu?
questions.answer: The breakthrough time of SO2 on SIFSIX-2-Cu-i (1800 min g−1) exceeded that on SIFSIX-1-Cu, consistent with its higher SO2 adsorption capacity in static adsorption experiments at 298 K and 0.002 bar.

questions.question: What experimental techniques were used to confirm the adsorbed positions of SO2 molecules in the crystal structure of SIFSIX materials?
questions.answer: Rietveld refinement of the powder X-ray diffraction patterns of SO2-loaded samples was used to locate the adsorbed positions of SO2 molecules in the crystal structure of SIFSIX materials.

questions.question: Is the CO2 adsorption capacity on SIFSIX-3-Ni higher than its SO2 adsorption capacity?
questions.answer: True, the CO2 capacity on SIFSIX-3-Ni is higher than the SO2 capacity.

questions.question: Does the SIFSIX-1-Cu material achieve a higher SO2 adsorption capacity at 273 K compared to 298 K?
questions.answer: False, the text does not provide specific comparative values of SO2 adsorption capacity at 273 K and 298 K for SIFSIX-1-Cu to confirm this.

questions.question: Are the SIFSIX materials capable of achieving high SO2/CH4 selectivity?
questions.answer: True, SIFSIX materials achieve high SO2/CH4 selectivities over a wide range of SO2 molar fraction.

questions.question: What is the impact of the SIFSIX-2-Cu-i's framework interpenetration on its SO2 adsorption capacity?
questions.answer: The framework interpenetration in SIFSIX-2-Cu-i results in a more compact unit cell and stronger Sδ+···Fδ− electrostatic interactions, significantly enhancing its SO2 adsorption capacity at low pressures.
